section.title: Graph processing
section.para: Many of the Gwyddion data processing modules produce graph as a output. Graphs can be exported into ASCII files or further analyzed within Gwyddion by several graph processing modules. These modules can be found in the Graph menu in the Gwyddion main window. Note that the number of graph modules is really limited now and consists of basic modules for doing things that are very frequent within SPM data analysis. For more analytical tools you can use your favorite graph processing program.
In this section the graph modules present in Gwyddion are shortly presented

section.title: Basic operations
section.para: First of all there are zooming and data reading modules in Graph menu.

itemizedlist.listitem: Zoom in and zoom out - simply draw are that should be zoomed by mouse and zoom. Zoom out restores state whne all data can be seen.
Read value - prints X and Y value under cursor
Measure distances - enables user to select several points within graph and prints out their distances and angles between them.

section.title: Fit graph
section.para: This module is designed namely for fitting the statistical function by means of functions mostly used in roughness parameters evaluation. This influences the possible functions to be fitted that are currently namely various statistical functions for surface having Gaussian or exponential autocorrelation function.

Within fit module you can select area that should be fitted (by mouse or by entries), try some initial parameters (or let the module to guess them) and fit the data using Marquardt-Levenberg algorithm.
As a result you obtain fit and set of its parameters. These can be saved into a file.

section.title: Critical dimension
section.para: Critical dimension module can be used to fit some "typical" objects that can be often found while analyzing microchips and related surfaces. These objects are found in the graph and their properties are evaluated.
User interface of this module is practically same as for the graph fit module.
